clinical_study.brief_title: Music Therapy for Post-cardiac Surgery Pain Management
clinical_study.official_title: Music Therapy as a Supplement to Post Surgery Pain Management in Cardiac Surgery Patient Following Median Sternotomy

lead_sponsor.agency: Steward St. Elizabeth's Medical Center of Boston, Inc.

clinical_study.source: Steward St. Elizabeth's Medical Center of Boston, Inc.

brief_summary.textblock: Music therapy as a supplement to post surgery pain management in cardiac surgery patients following median sternotomy.

detailed_description.textblock:
2. Specific Aims:
1. Primary Aim: To assess whether music therapy can decrease the amount of opioid type pain medications used.
Hypothesis: Music therapy reduces the amount of opioid type pain medication used in management of post-operative pain and discomfort.
2. Secondary Aims:
i. To identify the gender and age groups of patients who can benefit from music therapy as a supplement to post-operative pain management.
Hypothesis: Majority of the population of patient benefits from music therapy as a supplement to postoperative pain management.
ii. To assess whether music therapy can increase patient satisfaction.
Hypothesis: Music therapy increases patient satisfaction.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Randomize patients into music treatment group and non-music treatment control group. 30 patients per group. Patients will be enrolled into each group on an alternate bases.

primary_outcome.measure: The amount of Opioid type pain medication used
primary_outcome.time_frame: In the immediate post operative period, while patient still in the ICU
primary_outcome.description: To assess whether the use of music therapy can decrease the amount of opioid type pain medications used.

arm_group.description: The nurse will set up the appropriate music genre for the each music treatment patient, based on patient's preference obtained from the pre-operative questionnaire, by using the bedside computer and using Pandora, the internet music streaming service.
No music treatment will be used. Standard pain and comfort measure only.

intervention.description: The nurse will set up the appropriate music genre for the each music treatment patient, based on patient's preference obtained from the pre-operative questionnaire, by using the bedside computer and using Pandora, the internet music streaming service.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients undergoing cardiac surgery via median sternotomy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Emergency cases.
- Patients with hearing impairment.
- Patients with dementia or other mental status changes.
- Patients who are clinically unstable postoperatively.
- Patients who develop postoperative complications.
- Patients who are non-English speaking.
